definitions.definition: To bring into existence; (sometimes in particular:)
definitions.example: You can create the color orange by mixing yellow and red.

definitions.definition: To cause, to bring (a non-object) about by an action, behavior, or event, to occasion.
definitions.example: A sudden chemical spill on the highway created a chain‐collision which created a record traffic jam.

definitions.definition: To confer or invest with a rank or title of nobility, to appoint, ordain or constitute.
definitions.example: Henry VIII created him a Duke.   Last month, the queen created two barons.

definitions.definition: To be or do something creative, imaginative, originative.
definitions.example: Children usually enjoy creating, never mind if it is of any use!

definitions.definition: In theatre, to be the first performer of a role; to originate a character.
To make a fuss, complain; to shout.
